document.heading: District of Columbia Youth Services Act of 1976 Amendment Act of 1992

history.narrative: Law 9-194, the “District of Columbia Youth Services Act of 1976 Amendment Act of 1992,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 9-450, which was referred to the Committee on Public Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on October 6, 1992, and November 4, 1992, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on November 23, 1992, it was assigned Act No. 9-315 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 9-194 became effective on March 16, 1993.

The Council of the District of Columbia hereby gives notice that the 30-day Congressional Review Period has expired, and therefore, cites this enactment as D.C. Law 9-194, effective March 16, 1993 J 0 ~P1~"I~I k S 0 N z/ C~h>~Ff~man of the Council bates Counted D_urin,cI the 30 Jay~Cx)~Qressional Review Period: January 6,20,21,22,25,26,2’}- February 2,3,4,16,17,18,19,22,23,24,25,26 March 1,2,3,4,5,8,9,10,11,12,15 AN ACT D,C, ACT 9-315 Enrolled Original Codific tiort District of Columbie Code Supplement) IN THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA NOVEMBER 23, 1992 To amend the District of Columbia Youth Services Act of 1976 to establish 2 Neighborhood Planning Councils in each election ward, to authorize the Mayor to adjust the boundaries of the Neighborhood Planning Councils, and to conduct Neighborhood Planning Council elections in even numbered years. BE IT ENACTED BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this act may be cited as the "District of Columbia Youth Services Act of 1976 Amendment Act of 1992 Sec. 2. The District of Columbia Youth Services Act of 1976, effective March 29, 1977 (D.C. Law 1-93; D.C. Code § 1-2601 et seq is amended as follows a) Section 2(c D.C. Code § 1-2601(3 is amended by striking the semicolon at the end thereof and inserting in its place the following phrase subject to modifications made by the Mayor pursuant to section 4a b) A new section 4a is added to read as follows Sec. 4a a) There shall be 2 Neighborhood Planning Councils in each election ward established pursuant to section 2 of the Boundaries Act of 1975, effective December 16, 1975 (D.C. Law 1-38; D.C. Code § 1-1308 The Mayor, by rulemaking, shall draw boundaries for Neighborhood Planning Councils, after each decennial census, so that they are approximately equal in population b)(1) ReguIar elections for the Neighborhood Planning Councils shall be held in even numbered years on a date set by the Mayor by rulemaking 2) Any Neighborhood Planning Council member holding office immediately prior to the effective date of the District of Columbia Youth Services Act of 1976 Emergency Amendment Act of 1992 may continue to hold office until a successor is elected and qualifies for office pursuant to this act Sec. 3. This act shall take effect after a 30-day period of Congressional review following approval by the Mayor (or in the event of veto by the Mayor, action by the Council of the District of Columbia to override the veto) as provided in section 602(c)(1) of the District of Columbia Self-Government and Governmental Reorganization Act, Section 1-2601 New Section 1-2603.1 Enrolled Original approved December 24, 1973 (87 Star. 813; D.C.
